Add Internal OME IDs to Class List

Source: R/OME_ids.R
add_OME_id.Rd

Assigns new internal OME IDs to individuals (students or teachers) in a class list who do not already have one. The OME ID is constructed using the format:


  PersonType + SchoolType + EstablishmentID + 5-digit unique numeric suffix

The resulting OME_ID always has a total length of 10 characters.

where:

  • `PersonType` = 1 for students, 2 for teachers.

  • `SchoolType` = numeric school type (1, 2, 3, or 4).

  • `EstablishmentID` = a 3-digit identifier for the school.

  • The final 5-digit suffix comes from the supplied `available_ids` vector.

Only individuals missing an OME_ID (NA or empty string) are assigned a new ID.

Usage

add_OME_id(class_list, available_ids, person_type = "student")

Arguments

class_list

A data frame containing the columns: "EstablishmentID", "SchoolType", and "OME_ID". The `EstablishmentID` must be exactly 3 digits.

available_ids

A character vector of available 5-digit suffixes (e.g., c("00001", "00002", "00003")) to be used for new IDs.

person_type

Either "student" or "teacher". Determines the first digit of the ID (1 for students, 2 for teachers).

Value

A list containing:

  • `class_list`: The input data frame with the "OME_ID" column updated to include new IDs for individuals who were missing one.

  • `new_ids`: A data frame containing only the rows where new OME_IDs were assigned, including key identifying columns.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
class_list <- data.frame(
  EstablishmentID = c("123", "123", "456", "456"),
  SchoolType = c(1, 1, 2, 4),
  OME_ID = c(NA, "", "21245600001", ""),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

available_ids <- sprintf("%05d", 1:100)

# Add new IDs for students
result <- add_OME_id(class_list, available_ids, person_type = "student")
result$class_list
result$new_ids

# Add new IDs for teachers
add_OME_id(class_list, available_ids, person_type = "teacher")
} # }
